alert.note: Alert for Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 20 at 12:18PM PST until February 22 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TUESDAY TO 4 PM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TUESDAY TO 4 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 2000 feet, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, with up to 12 inches at higher elevations. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory above 1500 feet, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Western Siskiyou County, including the communities of Happy Camp, Scott Bar, and Highway 96 west of Klamath River. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 10 AM Tuesday to 4 PM PST Wednesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 1 PM Tuesday to 4 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible above 2000 ft. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
